info.title: Payment
info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF 676 - Payment

This API provides the standardized client interface to Payment Systems for managing performed payments or refunds. Examples of Payment API originators (clients) include Web servers, mobile app servers, Contact center dashboards or retail store systems.

Money.description: A base / value business entity used to represent money

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency)

Payment.description: The Payment resource represents a performed payment. It contains both information about the payment and the payment method used to perform it.

authorizationCode.description: Authorization code retrieved from an external payment gateway that could be used for conciliation

correlatorId.description: Unique identifier in the client for the payment in case it is needed to correlate

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment

paymentDate.description: Date when the payment was performed

statusDate.description: Date when the status was recorded

amount.description: Amount to be paid (net of taxes)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

The Payment resource represents a performed payment. It contains both information about the payment and the payment method used to perform it.

correlatorId.description: Unique identifier in the client for the payment in case it is needed to correlate

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment

PaymentItem.description: The paymentItem is the result of lettering process. It enables to assign automatically or manually part of incoming payment amount to a bill

id.description: Unique identifier of the payment Item

amount.description: Amount to be paid (net of taxes)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

PaymentMethod.description: Defines a specific method of payment (e.g. direct debit with all details associated)

authorizationCode.description: Review: Authorization code provided by a financial institution. Typically this would be populated for recurring payments using the method, as payments have an authorization code of their own.

description.description: Text description of the contents of the payment method

isPreferred.description: If the method is the preferred one by the owner. Typically used when querying for the payment methods of a specific customer or account

name.description: Friendly name assigned to the payment method

statusDate.description: The last time the payment method status changed.

statusReason.example: This payment method has expired, therefore its status is now inactive.
statusReason.description: The reason for the last status change.

account.description: Reference to the accounts that are linked to the payment method. May be a party account or a financial account.

relatedParty.description: Reference to the customer or party that owns that payment method or can use it.

relatedPlace.description: Reference to a place for billing or delivery address, if different to that of the related party.

validFor.description: Date interval in which the payment method is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: Type of payment method (e.g.: bank card, cash, voucher, etc). The details field type depends on the value assigned to this one.

PaymentMethodRef.description: PaymentMethod reference. A payment method defines a specific mean of payment (e.g direct debit).

PointOfInteraction.description: POI consists of hardware and software which enables a Cardholder and/or an Acceptor to perform a Local Card transaction. This is also referred to as a Physical/EMV Terminal. It may be Attended or Unattended.

modeOfEntry.description: Key entry code that tells the processor how the transaction was captured.

retrievalReferenceNumber.description: The reference number used to identify a given transaction that allow the Acceptor or Acquirer to keep track of their transactions

transactionDate.description: Date time related to the POI transaction.

resource.description: A POI is a Physical POI or a Remote POI, as a resource.

Refund.description: The Refund resource represents a performed Refund. It contains both information about the refund and the payment method used to perform it.

authorizationCode.description: Authorization code retrieved from an external payment gateway that could be used for conciliation

correlatorId.description: Unique identifier in the client for the refund in case it is needed to correlate

description.description: Text describing the contents of the refund

refundDate.description: Date when the refund was performed

statusDate.description: Date when the status was recorded

amount.description: Amount to be refunded (net of taxes)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
